name: market for chemi-thermomechanical pulp | chemi-thermomechanical pulp | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/768/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'chemi-thermomechanical pulp', in the Global geography.;This product is generally considered to be used at the production site.  Therefore, the market does not contain any transport.;The product “chemi-thermomechanical pulp” (CTMP) is a type of unbleached, mechanical, wood-containing pulp. Mechanical pulp is weaker than chemical pulp (sulfate and sulfite pulp) but has a higher light-scattering coefficients and opacity. In the CTMP production process, wood chips are impregnated with chemicals (sulfonation with Na2SO3) before they are mechanically defibrated in the refiner under high pressure (~about 3 bar) or at atmospheric pressure, mainly in two stages. During mechanical defibration, lignin is plasticised and remains in the pulp. CTMP cannot be brightened effectively by oxidative and reductive bleaching. Most of the mechanical pulp is produced at integrated pulp mills which directly process it further into (paper-) products and only a minor part of pulp production is sold on the market. CTMP  is mainly used for Printing & writing papers, tissue and packaging boards. 

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'chemi-thermomechanical pulp',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of  chemi-thermomechanical pulp', to the consumers of this product. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
